name: 3 Words and an Aesthetic
description:
A game by Keli Lindsey, Loan Tran, Aaliyah Madison, Eliana Cadelina for UCSC ARTG 80I Foundations of Play.

Just download the game file and import on https://playingcards.io/ to play!

Rules:

  1. Player order is determined by order of Month and Day of birth.
  2. Player draws a card to hand and has to describe the aesthetic in 3 clues before starting the timer. If a player uses more than 3 words, they must deduct a point for each extra word from their score total. 
    1. Note that players cannot use words in the aesthetic title to describe it.
    2. Player starts the timer after their 3 clues were given.
  3. Other players have to guess the aesthetic, the first player to guess correctly gets points.
  4. Players get 30 seconds to guess for each round. Guessing correctly within 10 seconds earns 3 points, 20 seconds earns 2 points, and 30 seconds earns 1 point. Individual players will keep track of their own points. 
  5. If the player draws a wild card, they can think of their own aesthetic. Wild cards are worth 5 points normally. Players are allowed to skip the wild card, but deduct 1 point from their score total.
  6. Players that describe their aesthetic effectively will earn the same amount of points as the player that guesses correctly in all instances.
  7. First player to 25 points wins, otherwise play until the deck runs out and whoever scores the highest, wins.
